greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of real root of x^5 - x^3 - x^2 - x - 1.
comment: This root is also the sixth smallest of the Pisot numbers.
link: Iain Fox, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Pisot Number
mathematica: RealDigits[ Solve[ x^5 - x^3 - x^2 - x - 1 == 0, x, WorkingPrecision -> 111][[-1, 1, 2]], 10, 111][[1]] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Nov 04 2017 *)
program: (PARI) solve(x=1, 2, x^5 - x^3 - x^2 - x - 1) \\ _Michel Marcus_, Oct 13 2017
(PARI) default(realprecision, 20080); x=solve(x=1, 2, x^5 - x^3 - x^2 - x - 1); for (n=1, 20000, d=floor(x); x=(x-d)*10; write("b293509.txt", n, " ", d)); \\ _Iain Fox_, Oct 23 2017
(PARI) polrootsreal(x^5 - x^3 - x^2 - x - 1)[1] \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Nov 04 2017
results.author: _Iain Fox_, Oct 11 2017
